sect1.title: Becoming a DarwinPorts committer
sect1.para: Becoming a member of the DarwinPorts project with commit access to our CVS repository is pretty much a matter of involvement in any of the project areas and the record you can establish thereof. We encourage any developer and/or volunteer to apply for a CVS account if certain simple requirements are met:

listitem.para: One key attribute of any DarwinPorts committer must be enthusiasm for the project, so therefore we appreciate applicants who've shown their involvement through active participation on the main user list, either through general user support and/or project roadmap discussion and brainstorming.

If applying for access to the "dports" section of the project, an established record as a maintainer of already existing ports is preferable. This can be accomplished either through the inheritance of abandoned ports (those with the sole darwinports [at] opendarwin DOT org maintainer address) or through writing your own from scratch. If instead you plan to apply to any other area, like "base" or "www", contributions in the form of patches that can vouch for your skills on the aspects you plan to help with are certainly a big plus. In all cases, submissions to the project should be processed per the instructions detailed on the "DarwinPorts Submissions" chapter.

sect1.para: If you feel you meet and comply with these requirements and wish to become a member of the group to help out personally, do feel free to send a note to the portmgr [at] opendarwin DOT org steering committee explaining your contributions, how long you've been involved and why you'd make a good committer. The sole purpose of said forum is overseeing the general evolution of the project, so they are the ones to turn to for membership requests.

For a brief listing of the duties & benefits resulting from holding an OpenDarwin account, along with a short jump start on CVS primaries, read OpenDarwin's Committer's Guide for account applicants. The New Committer's Guide is also a must read for new comers to become acquainted with our procedures and guidelines.
